title: Five Million Ukrainian Refugees
sub_head: The U.S. has room to take more than 100,000 of the displaced.
body:
Russia is escalating its war in Ukraine again, with a new offensive in the east and missile strikes against cities across the country. The assaults are likely to accelerate the flood of refugees that reached a grim milestone this week. More than five million Ukrainians have fled the nation of 43 million since the war began Feb. 24, according to the United Nations refugee agency.
The flight to the European Union has been staggering: Poland (2,847,540), Romania (763,769), Hungary (476,213) and Slovakia (346,175). Tiny Moldova, a Ukrainian neighbor and EU aspirant, has taken in 428,577. For comparison, the Syrian civil war created some 6.8 million refugees over a decade.
